channel.title: Comments on: SSRS Properties – Chart Axis Minimum, Maximum, and Interval
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alphonsa
item.dc:creator: Alphonsa
item.description: Is it possible to add date and numbers in Scalar axis type? I've 2 category group Sessiondate and Rownum for scalar axis type
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to add date and numbers in Scalar axis type? I’ve 2 category group Sessiondate and Rownum for scalar axis type

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: You'd do that by setting parameters on the report, and only running it for 3 or 4 years.
item.content:encoded: You’d do that by setting parameters on the report, and only running it for 3 or 4 years.

item.title: By: Martin
item.dc:creator: Martin
item.description: Is it possible to mix a maximum number of Interval ? In your example you have 4 different year. But, is it possible for fix it a 3 year maximun ? Or dynamically change this number depending on the situation.
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to mix a maximum number of Interval ? In your example you have 4 different year. But, is it possible for fix it a 3 year maximun ? Or dynamically change this number depending on the situation.

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Unfortunately, I don't know. That might be a good question to post in our forums!
item.content:encoded: Unfortunately, I don’t know. That might be a good question to post in our forums!

item.title: By: Alan
item.dc:creator: Alan
item.description:
I set my maximum and minimum values, but my chart still scales itself at runtime based on the data that is being graphed. In my application, i never want the chart to re-scale even if i exceed a maximum limit (in that case, i want the line chart to be discontinuous). What settings must i select to get this behavior?
thanks,
item.content:encoded:
I set my maximum and minimum values, but my chart still scales itself at runtime based on the data that is being graphed. In my application, i never want the chart to re-scale even if i exceed a maximum limit (in that case, i want the line chart to be discontinuous). What settings must i select to get this behavior?

thanks,

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Suresh, if you can group your data together by quarter, then you can display it that way.
item.content:encoded: Suresh, if you can group your data together by quarter, then you can display it that way.

item.title: By: Suresh
item.dc:creator: Suresh
item.description: Is it possible to show x-axis interval as quarter instead of year? I am expecting the date has to be showing as Q1 Q2 for that year.
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to show x-axis interval as quarter instead of year? I am expecting the date has to be showing as Q1 Q2 for that year.

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Guillaume - you can add parameters to the report, and set the max and min equal to the parameters using an expression. If you didn't want the user entering their own parameter values, you could hard-code them or pull them from another dataset.
item.content:encoded: Guillaume – you can add parameters to the report, and set the max and min equal to the parameters using an expression. If you didn’t want the user entering their own parameter values, you could hard-code them or pull them from another dataset.

item.title: By: Guillaume
item.dc:creator: Guillaume
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

Is there any way to set the maximum and the minimum using a dataset or a variable ?

Thanks,

Guillaume
